15522.「これがあれば 清めの儀式ができる。\n 正式な儀式など もう何年ぶりになるだろ:
With this, I can perform a purification
ceremony. It's been years since I've had a
formal ceremony.

15523.「では わしは さっそく\n 村の武闘場へ 行くとしよう。\n <pc>も 後で:
I will go to the Village Arena as soon as I
can. I'd like to see <pc> later.

15524.「これを逃すと 次にやるのが いつになるか\n わからんからな。ガハハ！:
If I miss this one, I don't know when I'll get
to do the next one. Gahaha!

15525.「この場所で 我らを見守る 戦いの神よ……。\n 今日の勝者に さらなる強者との:
God of war, who watches over us in this place, may the winners of this day meet with more strength. To the losers, may they find the
courage to fight again.

15526.「そして その両者に\n 死を恐れず 勇ましく 戦い抜いたことへの\n 惜しみな:
And to both of them, give unreserved tribute
for fighting bravely and without fear of
death...

15527.「これで 清めの儀式は終わりだ。: Now the purification ritual is over.

15528.「すっげー！\n いつもは お祈りだけの 短いやつだから\n こんな本格的なの:
Wow! I've never seen such a full-fledged
prayer before, since I usually just do short
prayers!

15529.「戦いの前に 毎回 これをやるのが本当なのだ。\n 最近は すっかり略式ばかりに:
It is true that we do this every time before a
battle. These days, though, it's all very
abbreviated.

15530.「ねえねえ そんおー！\n お塩を ブワワワアってするのは どうして？:
Hey, hey, hey... So-o-o! What's with the salt
and the bubbles?

15531.「この場所で 戦いの果てに死んでいった者たちの\n 魂を鎮めるためだ。……そして:
We do this to appease the souls of those who
have died in battle here. ...and to pray that
they will watch over us.

15532.「……かつて 神が見守る この武闘場では\n 毎日のように 想像を絶する\n 激:
...Once upon a time, in this battlefield
watched over by the gods, unimaginable fights
to the death were fought every day.

15533.「より強い者を生みだし さらなる高みを目指す。\n それが このランガーオ村の教:
Those Who Aim Higher. This was the teaching of
Langao Village.

15534.「そのために…… 勝者には すべてが与えられ\n 敗者は 残酷なまでに すべてを:
For this reason, the winner was given everything, and the loser was cruelly deprived of everything. Everyone believed it was for
the good of the village.

15536.「ハイハイハイ！！ オイラ知ってる！: Hi, hi, hi! I know what you mean!

15537.「今は 勝ったほうだけじゃなくて\n 負けたほうにも ケイイを払うんだよねっ！:
Now, not only the winner but also the loser
will be paid!

15539.「死への恐怖に打ち勝ち 勇気を持って\n 戦った両者を 等しく敬え。\n それが:
Honor equally both those who overcame their
fear of death and fought bravely. That is the
current teaching of this village.

15540.「ランガーオ村の 子供たちよ！\n さっき見た儀式とともに その教えを\n 決し:
Children of Langao Village! With the rituals
you have just witnessed, never forget its
teachings and grow strong!

15541.「<pc> 見ていたか。\n この村の子供たちは\n なかなか たくましいだろう:
<pc> did you see that? The children
in this village are quite sturdy, aren't they?

15542.「敗者にも 勝者と同じように敬意を払う……。\n 子供たちが そのことを\n わ:
We give the losers the same respect as the
winners... as long as the kids understand
that, they'll be fine.

15543.「きっと この村を 正しい未来へと\n 導いてくれるだろう……。:
I am sure they will lead this village to the
right future...

15544.「おっと いかん。\n <pc>に 塩を採ってきてもらった\n 礼を まだ して:
Oh, no. I haven't thanked <pc> for
the salt.

15545.「遅くなって すまなかったな！\n さあ 受け取ってくれ！: Sorry I'm late! Come on, take it!

15546.「おお <pc>。\n 村王ならば 村の武闘場で\n 清めの儀式を おこなってい:
Oh <pc>. If you're looking for the
Village King, he's performing a purification
ceremony in the Village Arena.

15547.「村王は エゼソルトを 採ってきてくれた\n <pc>にも 見せたいらしいので\:
The village king wants to show Eze Salt to
<pc>, who picked it up for him, so
you should definitely go there.
